title: Highbridge
medium: graphite, pen and ink, crayon, charcoal, watercolor, and pastel on paper
credit_line: Bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Preston Dickinson [1891-1930]. Arthur B. Davies [1863-1928], New York, NY, until October 24, 1928; estate of Arthur B. Davies, New York, NY, until April 17, 1929 [1]; sale, American Art Association, New York, NY, April 17, 1929 [1]. Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., New York, NY, by November 1951 until January 1954; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. [1898-1993] James H. Beal, Pittsburgh, PA, January 1954 until February 14, 1987 [2]; Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones), Pittsburgh, PA, until April 23, 1993; bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1994.

Notes:
[1]. Arthur B. Davies sale, American Art Association, New York, NY, April 16-17, 1929, probably no. 416, sold for $150 (see curatorial file.) The Arthur B. Davis provenance is referred to in correspondence between Mrs. Rebecca Beal and the Rehn Gallery (see curatorial file for copies of correspondence, dated September 23 and 26, 1953, and April 27, 1954, from the Frank K.M. Rehn Galleries records, Archives of American Art.)
[2]. Mrs. Beal purchased the work for $250 (see copy of letter from Mrs. Beal to John Clancy, Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., dated January 9, 1953 but, based on related correspondence in note [1], it likely is from January 9, 1954 (copy from Archives of American Art.)
